TopicTitle: KSP Loading... 1.8 Preview: Service Bays Revamp

Articles.Content:
Hello Kerbonauts it's time for a new KSP Loading 1.8 This time we want to show you a preview for the Service Bays Revamp.  

Image HQ here
Awesome!  I've been hoping for this!
Nice. I wish we had a variant without top and bottom surfaces (like Mk3 bays) so that they can be stacked seamlessly to form one long bay...
Wow... that's nice. Will we also get a service bay sized for the capsules in Making History? Just asking for a friend...

Just now, sh1pman said:

Nice. I wish we had a variant without top and bottom surfaces (like Mk3 bays) so that they can be stacked seamlessly to form one long bay...

Yes 110% this. Likes are disabled so consider this one.
While a welcome upgrade in looks... have you looked at resolving the disproportionate drag of service bays when the internal (shielded!) nodes are left open/unused?
nice, but not as good as ReStock. This is your job, put some effort in. If a group of volunteers on the internet can out do you, you're doing something wrong.
Don’t get me wrong, I’m very grateful for the continued development for KSP, but I’d really like to see a 1.875m variant for Making History.

Awesome!They look so nice!

@St4rdust Can we limit how much the doors will open like the cargo bay doors?
The Doors look a bit rough/bumpy, but other than that, they look a lot more like something that actually belongs on a rocket.

Excellent! It seems that it will fit well with the existing parts. The old one was always a bit awkward. I also appreciate how the doors fold; nice and compact. As stated above, the hollow variant would be much appreciated. 
 

Thank you, and keep up the good work!

Not bad, but the black hole in the top is not a good idea. It looks odd and has no good reason to be there. If it's supposed to be hollow, then make a real hole. ReStock one is better, including not having that issue.
Its possible choose only one door to open? Disable one side?

Ooo...nice! Looking forward to seeing it in game

12 minutes ago, Barzon said:

nice, but not as good as ReStock. This is your job, put some effort in. If a group of volunteers on the internet can out do you, you're doing something wrong.

Come on, it’s not that bad. I’m sure they’ve put a bunch of effort in.

Besides, this is a matter of opinion. Personally, I prefer the stock art style, so I stick with that. If you prefer Restock, then go ahead. Your game, your choice.

The new versions are visually better, no doubt.

But I also like the cool old school look of the older parts. Could it be possible to make them optional somehow?

I have to admit, the old service bays were one of the things that drew me to try Restock - although I love a lot of the other things too much now to give it up.   I am glad to see them being redone, it's a huge improvement.

2 minutes ago, Lisias said:

The new versions are visually better, no doubt.

But I also like the cool old school look of the older parts. Could it be possible to make them optional somehow?

Can't say for sure, but SOP for Squad has always been to deprecate the old parts by hiding them rather than actually replacing them.

The new parts usually have the same name but with _v2 appended and the category set to something non-existent.

The Stayputnik for example: The old one is still there somewhere as probeCoreSphere with category = none

The new one being name = probeCoreSphere_v2

1 minute ago, Starwaster said:

Can't say for sure, but SOP for Squad has always been to deprecate the old parts by hiding them rather than actually replacing them.

The new parts usually have the same name but with _v2 appended and the category set to something non-existent.

The Stayputnik for example: The old one is still there somewhere as probeCoreSphere with category = none

The new one being name = probeCoreSphere_v2

This will be the case for this revamp.

They look nice!

but...

Do they create the same drag as the old versions when open? Cargo bays were a verry good early career airbrake 

And could you please make them open at least as far as the old ones? The angle looks smaller than before, limiting usability. Better would completely open (eg 180degrees to each other when open)

I also like the ideas to open only one side and have adjustable angles, as well as stackable open variants. The game is really missing round large cargo bays.

8 minutes ago, Kergarin said:

They look nice!

but...

Do they create the same drag as the old versions when open? Cargo bays were a verry good early career airbrake 

Finally, someone asking the important questions! Also, can you put a command chair in the 1.25m one and land a Kerbal in it with no chutes?

1 hour ago, Dragon01 said:

Not bad, but the black hole in the top is not a good idea. It looks odd and has no good reason to be there. If it's supposed to be hollow, then make a real hole. 

Agree. Why is there a black hole in the middle ?
Bradley Whitstance will either love this or have trouble with it

To me the new one looks like the old style metal garbage can. It was cut up and modified with doors. Very Kerbal IMO. I like it!

But yes,. I hope whatever Kerbal cut it up also fixed the drag.

2 hours ago, Dragon01 said:

Not bad, but the black hole in the top is not a good idea.

I've never understood why Squad likes giant black dots so much.
Why are the revamp parts so bland? The new doors are cool but those textures... Please stop.
